intro: Solandra minor, commonly known as the night-blooming cereus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white flowers that open at night. The plant has a woody stem and produces large, spiny leaves. It thrives in warm, dry climates and requires well-drained soil. Solandra minor is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its unique nocturnal blooming habit.
